result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Cintron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
COURT ORDERS AS TO COUNTS ONE, TWO, THREE AND FOUR: 
No contact with the victim(s).
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation.  Follow any recommended treatment.
Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation.  Follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  All to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b)  and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment (ref. case# 15CF937).
Pay DNA surcharge.  
Restitution set at zero.
**09-20-2016/Judge M. Joseph Donald
Court ordered DNA surcharges on counts one, two and three are VACATED.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts two, three and four; and concurrent with case 15CF937.  **ALL COUNTS:  Will be served in Wisconsin State Prison.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, three, and four; and concurrent with case 15CF937.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, two, four and concurrent with case 15CF937.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, two, three and concurrent with case 15CF937.

Defendant Edward Cintron in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Edward Cintron in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by Victoria C.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the House of Correction for 90 DAYS (will be served in Wisconsin State Prisons); concurrent to Counts 2, 3, and 4; concurrent to case# 15CF937.  
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the House of Correction for 6 MONTHS (will be served in Wisconsin State Prisons); concurrent to Counts 1, 3, and 4; concurrent to case# 15CF937.  
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the House of Correction for 6 MONTHS (will be served in Wisconsin State Prisons); concurrent to Counts 1, 2, and 4; concurrent to case# 15CF937.  
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the House of Correction for 90 DAYS (will be served in Wisconsin State Prisons); concurrent to Counts 1, 2, and 3; concurrent to case# 15CF937.  
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

OTHER COURT ORDERS (AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, & 4):
* No contact with the victim(s).
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with a sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment (ref. case# 15CF937).
* PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment (ref. case# 15CF937).

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Edward Cintron in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Edward Cintron in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury continued their deliberations at 8:35 AM.
 At the hour of 10:41 AM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict as follows:

AS TO COUNT 1:  GUILTY
AS TO COUNT 2:  GUILTY
AS TO COUNT 3:  GUILTY
AS TO COUNT 4:  GUILTY


which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  

Court ordered a PSI.

Case adjourned to 10-08-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Edward Cintron in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Edward Cintron in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for continuation of Jury Trial.
Jury in box at 10:45 AM.
Sworn for state as rebuttal witness:  MPD Officer Ronald Ziarnick.
State rests.
Jury out of box at 10:54 AM.

Statements made.
Jury in box at 11:35 AM.
Court entered and received into evidence exhibit# 19.
Defense played portions of MPD's cd interview with the defendant.
Defense rests.
Testimony closed.
Court breaks for lunch.
Jury out of box at 12:01 PM.

Defense motion to dismiss Count #1 at close of evidence argued and denied by the court. 
Jury in box at 2:13 PM.
Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:42 PM to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Pelowski and Floryance who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
Jury out of box at 3:43 PM.

Time is now 4:55 PM and court concluded for the day.
Court instructed jury to return tomorrow at 9:00 PM to continue their deliberations.

Case adjourned to 08-28-2015 at 9:00 AM for Continuation of Jury Trial.

Court breaks for lunch.
Jury out of box at 11:35 AM.

State rests subject to rebuttal.

Defense motion for dismissal of Count #1 in case# 15CF937 at close of state's case argued and DENIED by the court.  
Court "amended" the complaint in case# 15CM893 as set forth on the record.
Court examined the defendant as to his right to testify AND his right not to testify.
Court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waived his right not to testify.
Jury in the box at 2:01 PM.  
Sworn and testified as a witness for defense:  Defendant, Eduardo Cintron.  
Court takes a break.
Jury out of box at 3:31 PM.

Jury in box at 4:08 PM.
Re-sworn and testified:  MPD Detective Amy Stolowski.
Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness:  Rafael H. and MPD Detective Brendan Dolan.  
Time is now 4:51 PM and Court concluded for the day.
Court instructed jury to return tomorrow at 10:00 AM.
Jury out of box at 4:52 PM.

Court entered and received into evidence exhibit #s 14, 15, 16, 17, and 18.

Case adjourned to 08-27-2015 at 10:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Continuation of Jury Trial.

Defendant Edward Cintron in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Edward Cintron in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case, this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.   Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Case is adjourned to Branch 44 for pre-trial conference.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
